priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Microscopic Findings Test Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C132262

self.title: CDISC SDTM Microscopic Findings Test Name Terminology

definition: Terminology for the test names concerned with the clinical findings from a specimen that are visible by microscopic analysis.
name: SDTM Microscopic Findings Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Microscopic Findings Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of the abnormal cells in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of acidophil bodies in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the ALK receptor tyrosine kinase in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the alpha-methylacyl coenzyme A racemase in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the androgen receptor variant 7 in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the apoptotic cells in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the apoptotic cells to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Apoptotic Cell to Total Cell Count

terms.definition: An evaluation of tissue architectural changes in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of the arteriolar hyaline thickening of vessels in a biological specimen.
The histologic evaluation and diagnosis of the type of renal allograft rejection based on kidney biopsies and the Banff Working Classification from the Banff Foundation for Allograft Pathology. (NCI)
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the basophils to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).
terms.preferredTerm: Basophil to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the beta-defensin 1 in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the beta-defensin 2 in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the blasts to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Blasts to Total Cells Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of the blood vessel density in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the bradykinin receptor B1 in a biological specimen.
A measurement of BRCA1 protein in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Breast Cancer Type 1 Susceptibility Protein Measurement

terms.definition: A count of the CD20 expressing cells per unit in a biological specimen.
A count of the CD3 expressing cells per unit in a biological specimen.
A count of the CD4 expressing cells per unit in a biological specimen.
A count of the CD56 expressing cells per unit of a biological specimen.
A count of the CD68 expressing cells per unit in a biological specimen.
A count of the CD8 expressing cells per unit in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the CDX2 antigen in a biological specimen.
An interpretive assessment of the proportion of various cell types in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of cellular maturity and specialization in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the degree, quality or condition of cells in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of chronic inflammatory infiltrate in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of crypt abscess in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of the extent of the architectural damage to the crypts in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of cryptitis in a biological specimen.
An assessment by microscopic analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal structure and function.
A measurement of the cytokeratin 16 in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the dendritic cell-lysosomal-associated membrane protein in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Dendritic Cell Lysosomal-Associated Membrane Protein Measurement

terms.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results or summary of such an investigation. (NCI)
A measurement of ecto-5'-nucleotidase in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the EGFR protein with a specified variation(s) (mutations, deletions, insertions, etc.) in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the eosinophils to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).
terms.preferredTerm: Eosinophils to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the intact epithelial reticular basement membrane length to the total epithelial reticular basement membrane length in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Intact Epithelial Reticular Basement Membrane Length to Total Epithelial Reticular Basement Membrane Length Ratio Measurement
terms.submissionValue: Epi RBM Lngth, Intact/Epi RBM Lngth, Tot
synonyms: Epi RBM Lngth, Intact/Epi RBM Lngth, Tot
Epithelial RBM Length, Intact/Epithelial RBM Length, Total

terms.definition: A measurement of the epidermal growth factor receptor in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of epithelial damage in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of the integrity of the epithelium in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of the erosion and/or ulceration in a biological specimen.
A measurement of estrogen receptor protein in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of extramural venous invasion in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of fibrosis in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the folate hydrolase 1 in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the forkhead box protein 3 in a biological specimen.
A qualitative microscopic examination of tissue sections to determine the presence of pathologic finding(s). This term is intended to be used for non-targeted examinations.
An evaluation of glomerulitis in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of glomerulopathy in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the goblet cells in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the goblet cells to total epithelial cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Goblet Cell to Epithelial Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of granuloma(s) in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the granzyme B in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio) of the hematopoietic cells to adipocytes in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Hematopoietic Cells to Adipocytes Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of hepatocellular ballooning in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the hepatocyte growth factor receptor in a biological specimen.
The determination of the histologic type of cancer in a biological specimen.
A measurement of HER2 protein in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2 Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of infiltration of mononuclear cells in the lamina propria in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Infiltration of Mononuclear Cells in Lamina Propria Assessment
terms.submissionValue: Infilt of Mono Cells in Lamina Propria
synonyms: Infilt of Mono Cells in Lamina Propria
Infiltration of Mononuclear Cells in Lamina Propria

terms.definition: An evaluation of infiltration of polymorphonuclear cells in the lamina propria in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Infiltration of Polymorphonuclear Cells in Lamina Propria Assessment
terms.submissionValue: Infilt of PMN Cells in Lamina Propria
synonyms: Infilt of PMN Cells in Lamina Propria
Infiltration of Polymorphonuclear Cells in Lamina Propria

terms.definition: A measurement of the intercellular adhesion molecule 1 in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of interstitial fibrosis in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of intimal arteritis in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the intraepidermal nerve fiber density in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the lymphocytes to enterocytes within the epithelium of a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Intraepithelial Lymphocytes to Enterocytes Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of intraepithelial neoplasia in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the iron in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the Ki-67 protein in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of large lipogranuloma in a biological specimen.
A measurement of lipocalin-2 in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of lobular inflammation in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of lymph node extracapsular spread by the tumor in a biological specimen.
An indication as to whether cancer is present in the lymph nodes.
A condition or state of a lymph node at a particular time.
An evaluation of lymphatic invasion in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the lymphocyte function-associated antigen 1 in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the lymphocytes to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).
terms.preferredTerm: Lymphocyte to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the lymphoid aggregates in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the malignant lymphocytes in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the lymphoma cells to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Lymphoma Cell to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of pigmented macrophages in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of Mallory bodies in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the mast cells to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Mast Cell to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the maturing erythroid cells to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Maturing Erythroid Cell to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the megakaryoblasts to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).
terms.preferredTerm: Megakaryoblast to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of megamitochondria in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of mesangial matrix in a biological specimen.

A relative measurement (ratio or percentage ) of the metamyelocytes (small, myelocytic neutrophils with an indented nucleus) to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).
terms.preferredTerm: Metamyelocyte to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of microgranuloma in a biological specimen.
An assessment by microscope (e.g., light, electron, confocal, etc.).
An evaluation of microvesicular steatosis in a biological specimen.
The determination of the meaning of protein expression assessments across multiple mismatch repair proteins.
A measurement of the cells containing mitotic figures in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of the mitotic score in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of the mismatch repair proteins in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the monoblasts to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Monoblast to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the monocytes to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).
terms.preferredTerm: Monocytes to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of mononuclear cell interstitial inflammation in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the mononuclear cells in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the MLH1 mismatch repair protein in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the MLH3 mismatch repair protein in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the MSH2 mismatch repair protein in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the MSH3 mismatch repair protein in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the MSH6 mismatch repair protein in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the myeloblasts to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).
terms.preferredTerm: Myeloblast to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the myelocytes to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).
terms.preferredTerm: Myelocyte to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of myelofibrosis in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the neoplastic cells in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the neoplastic cells to total cells in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the banded neutrophils to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Neutrophil Band Form to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of neutrophils in the epithelium in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of neutrophils in the lamina propria in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of segmented neutrophils to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Segmented Neutrophil to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of NK2 homeobox 1 protein in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the normal cells to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Normal Cell to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of nuclear pleomorphism in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of glycogenated nuclei in a biological specimen.
The total number of tissue samples in which a pathological abnormality has been observed.
The total number of biopsy specimens in which a finding has been observed.
A measurement of the total number of lymph nodes that contain neoplastic cells.
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Lymph Nodes Involved With Neoplastic Cells
synonyms: Number of Lymph Nodes Positive for Neoplastic Cells

terms.definition: A measurement of the total number of core biopsies that contain malignant tissue. (NCI)
An assigned tumor grade based on a defined scoring system.
A measurement of the p16-INK4A in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of paneth cell metaplasia in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the PAX3-FKHR fusion protein in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (percentage) of in situ component present in a carcinoma compared to the entire malignant cellular proliferation. (NCI)
An evaluation of perineural invasion in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of peritubular capillaritis in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the phosphatase and tensin homolog in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the platelet and endothelial cell adhesion molecule 1 in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Platelet Endothelial Cell Adhesion Molecule 1 Measurement
synonyms: Platelet And Endothelial Cell Adhesion Molecule 1

terms.definition: A measurement of the PMS1 mismatch repair protein in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the PMS2 mismatch repair protein in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of polymorphonuclear cells in the epithelium in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the polysaccharides and mucosubstances in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of portal inflammation in a biological specimen.
An examination or assessment of the form and structure of premalignant cells.
An evaluation of premalignant cells in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the progesterone receptor protein in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the programmed death ligand 1 in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the proliferating myeloid cells to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Proliferating Myeloid Cell to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the promonocytes to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).
terms.preferredTerm: Promonocyte to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the promyelocytes (immature myelocytes) to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).

terms.definition: A measurement of the prostatic acid phosphatase in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the pyknotic cells in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of reticulocytes to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Reticulocyte to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the ROS proto-oncogene 1 protein in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the S100 calcium binding protein A7 in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: S100 Calcium Binding Protein A7 Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the total smooth muscle antibody in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of the amount or degree of steatosis (fatty tissue) in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of the predominant distribution pattern of steatosis (fatty tissue) in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the stromal cells to total cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Stromal Cell to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: The anatomical region or plane containing neoplastic tissue that has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient.
terms.preferredTerm: Anatomic Site for Involved Surgical Margin

terms.definition: The determination of the presence of actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. (NCI)
The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the mature plasma cells (plasmacytes) to total cells in a biological specimen (for example a bone marrow specimen).
terms.preferredTerm: Mature Plasma Cell to Total Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the transforming growth factor beta 1 in a biological specimen.
A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the transitional cells to the tumor cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Transitional Cell to Tumor Cell Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An evaluation of tubular atrophy in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of tubule formation in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of tubulitis in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of the morphologic appearance at the point where the tumor meets adjacent, non-tumor tissue.
An evaluation of the tissue architecture of the tumor in comparison to the non-pathological tissue the tumor arose from.
An evaluation of the tumor infiltration pattern in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the tumor protein p53 in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of tumor regression in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of ulceration in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of the fibrointimal thickening of vessels in a biological specimen.
An evaluation of vascular invasion in a biological specimen.
